bibl.title: In and out of the Rut: Callimachus fr. 1.25-28 and Anniceris of Cyrene.
bibl.note: There is a possible reference in the phrase ἴχνια μὴ καθ’ ὁμά | δίφρον ἐλ]ᾶν which commentators have not adduced: both the author of the Lucianic Encomium on Demosthenes [c. 23] and Aelian [Varia historia 2.27] relate an anecdote concerning the virtuoso skills in driving which Anniceris of Cyrene (perhaps one of Callimachus' ancestors) ostentatiously displayed.
bibl.seg: WILLIAMS Frederick, In and out of the Rut: Callimachus fr. 1.25-28 and Anniceris of Cyrene.

There is a possible reference in the phrase ἴχνια μὴ καθ’ ὁμά | δίφρον ἐλ]ᾶν which commentators have not adduced: both the author of the Lucianic Encomium on Demosthenes [c. 23] and Aelian [Varia historia 2.27] relate an anecdote concerning the virtuoso skills in driving which Anniceris of Cyrene (perhaps one of Callimachus' ancestors) ostentatiously displayed.
